title: Conducting Loop and Current Carrying Wire

content.question: A rectangular conducting loop is located above a long, straight wire carrying a current <math alttext="I" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to the right, as shown in the figure above. The wire and loop are both in the plane of the page. Which of the following will induce a clockwise current in the loop?

choices.label: Decreasing the current in the wire
Moving the loop to the right
Moving the loop to the left
Moving the loop up away from the wire
Moving the loop down toward the wire

content.answer: Moving the loop down toward the wire
